channel.title: Computer Problem
channel.description:
Well, my computer crashed. I was working with my friend to get Windows 7 and we haden't finished downloading it yet, and my internet went out, so I paused the download and tried to re-boot my computer. When I re-booted my computer it said there was a problem when I either turned off my computer or tried booting up, and everytime it goes on it turns off then back on. I tried wiping my hard-drive or turning the computer on with the disk, everytime I do that it says "Error with disk" says it is missing files or something. It is something diferent every time I tried. Any idea what I can do to fix it, or should I just throw it away? Lol.
- Thanks if you can help Spades

item.title: Computer Problem
item.dc:creator: @Jamie1200 Jamie1200
item.description:
@Jamie1200 wrote:

[quote=“Budda, post:3, topic:311441”]Both of you are retards.

  1. Why reboot your PC if the internet went out?
  2. Why would you go straight to formatting if you got a simple error at reboot?
  3. Why would downloading win7 make your PC fucked up? (Hint: it wouldn’t)
  4. Unless you managed to fry the hardware, all pc related problems can be fixed easily.
  5. You’re a fag.[/quote]

real mature.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Problem
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“the1337legend, post:22, topic:311441”]i only saw the words Download Windows 7, so am gunna guess at this.

Did you possibly download a leaked version of Windows 7 off the internet which could result in your problem?

Hense “i only saw the words Download Windows 7”, so yh, don’t bitch if what i say isn’t relevant, i’m just saying, not everything on the internet is legit.[/quote]

It possibly was a leech, but my friend had downloaded the exact same thing and had installed it to his computer as well. He had no problems and is not having any currently.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Problem
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:19, topic:311441”]My computer is a Desktop, and when I start it up, it just says there was a problem shutting down or there was a problem starting up. It gives me a couple different options on how I want to start up, I have tried them all Note I don’t remember all the options

1: Safe Mode
2: Safe Mode with something
3: Run with last succesful settings
4: Startup

I tried all of them and they all either start working then turn off the computer again or just say an error has occurred and doesn’t do anything, it just sits there.
So then I tried to boot with Disk, I put in the disk, and it started running properly loading all of the settings ect. Then it says there is an error. I get txt error a lot.[/quote] Does it say fatal error on a blue screen?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Problem
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

My computer is a Desktop, and when I start it up, it just says there was a problem shutting down or there was a problem starting up. It gives me a couple different options on how I want to start up, I have tried them all Note I don’t remember all the options

1: Safe Mode
2: Safe Mode with something
3: Run with last succesful settings
4: Startup

I tried all of them and they all either start working then turn off the computer again or just say an error has occurred and doesn’t do anything, it just sits there.

So then I tried to boot with Disk, I put in the disk, and it started running properly loading all of the settings ect. Then it says there is an error. I get txt error a lot.

item.title: Computer Problem
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:16, topic:311441”][quote author=warlok link=topic=407888.msg3015253#msg3015253 date=1257126509]
Why again did you reboot if your internet cut-out?
[/quote]

Because everytime I tried to enable my internet it said Connection Failed, and I had turned my router on and off trying to get my computer to re-connect, so I just thought if I re-boot my computer it would make the internet re-connect, as you can tell I was wrong.[/quote] You say that your computer wont open. Is it a laptop or computer?

Read full topic

Why again did you reboot if your internet cut-out?

Because everytime I tried to enable my internet it said Connection Failed, and I had turned my router on and off trying to get my computer to re-connect, so I just thought if I re-boot my computer it would make the internet re-connect, as you can tell I was wrong.

item.title: Computer Problem
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:6, topic:311441”][quote author=Spades link=topic=407888.msg3012468#msg3012468 date=1256890056]

Both of you are retards.

  1. Why reboot your PC if the internet went out?
  2. Why would you go straight to formatting if you got a simple error at reboot?
  3. Why would downloading win7 make your PC fucked up? (Hint: it wouldn’t)
  4. Unless you managed to fry the hardware, all pc related problems can be fixed easily.
  5. You’re a fag.

In what way did that help me?
If you can’t help then just shut the fuck up.
[/quote] The conclusion is that your a fag and should left your computer as it is.[/quote]
The conclusion is that you should shut the fuck up and GTFO his thread?

[quote=“Spades, post:1, topic:311441”]Well, my computer crashed. I was working with my friend to get Windows 7 and we haden’t finished downloading it yet, and my internet went out, so I paused the download and tried to re-boot my computer. When I re-booted my computer it said there was a problem when I either turned off my computer or tried booting up, and everytime it goes on it turns off then back on. I tried wiping my hard-drive or turning the computer on with the disk, everytime I do that it says “Error with disk” says it is missing files or something. It is something diferent every time I tried. Any idea what I can do to fix it, or should I just throw it away? Lol.

  • Thanks if you can help
    Spades[/quote]
    I don’t really understand what you need help with. Be more specific or take a picture of the problem and post it here?
